oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-03-19 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 19, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (host/performer), guest performer Roy Drusky, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Jimmie Selph, Chet Atkins, Archie Campbell, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1067th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Reeves; Jordanaires; Roy Drusky; Tommy Jackson; Jimmie Selph; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Jim Reeves -- In A Mansion Stands My Love (Jim Reeves) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces the Jordanaires -- One Of These Mornings (Jordanaires) -- Jim Reeves and Grant Turner introduce Roy Drusky -- Another (Roy Drusky, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces Tommy Jackson -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Jimmie Selph calls) -- Grant Turner and Jim Reeves talk -- How Long Has It Been (Jim Reeves, Jordanaires) -- Grant Turner introduces Chet Atkins -- Theme From A Summer Place (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Jordanaires (Musical group); Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Selph, Jimmy; Reeves, Jim; Drusky, Roy; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984
